sentence.Network_en: The first authoritative study of polio was published in 1840.
sentence.Network_cn: 关于小儿麻痹症的第一篇权威性研究报告发表于1840年。

sentence.Network_en: "Very well," I said, adopting a crisp authoritative tone.
sentence.Network_cn: “很好，”我用干脆的命令性的语气说道。

sentence.Network_en: He has a commanding presence and deep, authoritative voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他仪态威严，声音低沉，说话有威信。

entry.tran: 权威的;威严的;有威信的
entry.def: Someone or something that is authoritative gives an impression of power and importance and is likely to be obeyed.

example.ex: He has a commanding presence and deep, authoritative voice...
example.tran: 他仪态威严，声音低沉，说话有威信。

example.ex: Her smile was warm but authoritative.
example.tran: 她的笑容很和蔼，同时又透着威严。

entry.tran: （在某一方面）权威性的，可信的
entry.def: Someone or something that is authoritative has a lot of knowledge of a particular subject.

example.ex: The first authoritative study of polio was published in 1840...
example.tran: 关于小儿麻痹症的第一篇权威性研究报告发表于1840年。

example.ex: The evidence she uses is usually highly authoritative.
example.tran: 她采用的证据通常都具有很高的可信度。

means.word_mean: 1. having authority or ascendancy or influence;

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"有……倾向(性质)的;……的"; 2. 表名词,"人或物等"

stems_affixes.word_buile: affirm肯定+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.赞成的,肯定的
argument争论+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.爱争论的,好辩论的
authority权威,威信+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.权威性的,命令式的
e出+voc喊+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→把感情喊出来
figu形体,用形象比喻+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.比喻的,借喻的
lucr钱+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.赚钱的,有利可图的
represent代表+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.典型的,有代表性的
talk讲话+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.罗嗦的
preserve保存+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.&n.防腐的,防腐剂
sed坐+ative有……倾向(性质)的;……的→adj.&n.[药物]镇静的,镇静剂
represent描述,表示+ative人或物等→n.代表

means.word_mean: 显示权力的; 好像显示权威的

sentences.en: David speaks in an authoritative tone.
sentences.cn: 大卫以命令的口吻说话。

jushi.chinese: 大卫以命令的口吻说话。

jushi.english: This piece of news came from an authoritative source.
jushi.chinese: 这条消息来自权威人士。

jushi.english: Authoritative orders came to the ambassador from the president.
jushi.chinese: 大使收到了总统下达的正式命令。
